datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in global scope.
scope=global

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: sysgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: sysgrp

group-id.name: group-id
group-id.help: HA group ID  (0 - 1023;  or 0 - 7 when there are more than 2 vclusters). Must be the same for all members.

group-name.name: group-name
group-name.help: Cluster group name. Must be the same for all members.

mode.name: mode
mode.help: HA mode. Must be the same for all members. FGSP requires standalone.

sync-packet-balance.name: sync-packet-balance
sync-packet-balance.help: Enable/disable HA packet distribution to multiple CPUs.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable HA packet distribution to multiple CPUs.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable HA packet distribution to multiple CPUs

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable HA packet distribution to multiple CPUs.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable HA packet distribution to multiple CPUs

password.name: password
password.help: Cluster password. Must be the same for all members.

hbdev.name: hbdev
hbdev.help: Heartbeat interfaces. Must be the same for all members.

auto-virtual-mac-interface.name: auto-virtual-mac-interface
auto-virtual-mac-interface.help: The physical interface that will be assigned an auto-generated virtual MAC address.

backup-hbdev.name: backup-hbdev
backup-hbdev.help: Backup heartbeat interfaces. Must be the same for all members.

session-sync-dev.name: session-sync-dev
session-sync-dev.help: Offload session-sync process to kernel and sync sessions using connected interface(s) directly.

route-ttl.name: route-ttl
route-ttl.help: TTL for primary unit routes (5 - 3600 sec). Increase to maintain active routes during failover.

route-wait.name: route-wait
route-wait.help: Time to wait before sending new routes to the cluster (0 - 3600 sec).

route-hold.name: route-hold
route-hold.help: Time to wait between routing table updates to the cluster (0 - 3600 sec).

multicast-ttl.name: multicast-ttl
multicast-ttl.help: HA multicast TTL on primary (5 - 3600 sec).

evpn-ttl.name: evpn-ttl
evpn-ttl.help: HA EVPN FDB TTL on primary box (5 - 3600 sec).

load-balance-all.name: load-balance-all
load-balance-all.help: Enable to load balance TCP sessions. Disable to load balance proxy sessions only.

hb-interval.name: hb-interval
hb-interval.help: Time between sending heartbeat packets (1 - 20). Increase to reduce false positives.

hb-interval-in-milliseconds.name: hb-interval-in-milliseconds
hb-interval-in-milliseconds.help: Units of heartbeat interval time between sending heartbeat packets. Default is 100ms.

hb-lost-threshold.name: hb-lost-threshold
hb-lost-threshold.help: Number of lost heartbeats to signal a failure (1 - 60). Increase to reduce false positives.

hello-holddown.name: hello-holddown
hello-holddown.help: Time to wait before changing from hello to work state (5 - 300 sec).

gratuitous-arps.name: gratuitous-arps
gratuitous-arps.help: Enable/disable gratuitous ARPs. Disable if link-failed-signal enabled.

arps.name: arps
arps.help: Number of gratuitous ARPs (1 - 60). Lower to reduce traffic. Higher to reduce failover time.

arps-interval.name: arps-interval
arps-interval.help: Time between gratuitous ARPs  (1 - 20 sec). Lower to reduce failover time. Higher to reduce traffic.

session-pickup.name: session-pickup
session-pickup.help: Enable/disable session pickup. Enabling it can reduce session down time when fail over happens.

session-pickup-connectionless.name: session-pickup-connectionless
session-pickup-connectionless.help: Enable/disable UDP and ICMP session sync.

session-pickup-expectation.name: session-pickup-expectation
session-pickup-expectation.help: Enable/disable session helper expectation session sync for FGSP.

session-pickup-nat.name: session-pickup-nat
session-pickup-nat.help: Enable/disable NAT session sync for FGSP.

session-pickup-delay.name: session-pickup-delay
session-pickup-delay.help: Enable to sync sessions longer than 30 sec. Only longer lived sessions need to be synced.

link-failed-signal.name: link-failed-signal
link-failed-signal.help: Enable to shut down all interfaces for 1 sec after a failover. Use if gratuitous ARPs do not update network.

upgrade-mode.name: upgrade-mode
upgrade-mode.help: The mode to upgrade a cluster.

options.name: simultaneous
options.help: Upgrade all HA members at the same time.
options.label: Simultaneous
options.description: Upgrade all HA members at the same time

options.name: uninterruptible
options.help: Upgrade HA cluster without blocking network traffic.
options.label: Uninterruptible
options.description: Upgrade HA cluster without blocking network traffic

uninterruptible-primary-wait.name: uninterruptible-primary-wait
uninterruptible-primary-wait.help: Number of minutes the primary HA unit waits before the secondary HA unit is considered upgraded and the system is started before starting its own upgrade (15 - 300, default = 30).

ha-mgmt-status.name: ha-mgmt-status
ha-mgmt-status.help: Enable to reserve interfaces to manage individual cluster units.

ha-mgmt-interfaces.name: ha-mgmt-interfaces
ha-mgmt-interfaces.help: Reserve interfaces to manage individual cluster units.

interface.name: interface
interface.help: Interface to reserve for HA management.

dst.name: dst
dst.help: Default route destination for reserved HA management interface.

gateway.name: gateway
gateway.help: Default route gateway for reserved HA management interface.

dst6.name: dst6
dst6.help: Default IPv6 destination for reserved HA management interface.

gateway6.name: gateway6
gateway6.help: Default IPv6 gateway for reserved HA management interface.

hc-eth-type.name: hc-eth-type
hc-eth-type.help: Transparent mode HA heartbeat packet Ethertype (4-digit hex).

l2ep-eth-type.name: l2ep-eth-type
l2ep-eth-type.help: Telnet session HA heartbeat packet Ethertype (4-digit hex).

ha-uptime-diff-margin.name: ha-uptime-diff-margin
ha-uptime-diff-margin.help: Normally you would only reduce this value for failover testing.

unicast-gateway.name: unicast-gateway
unicast-gateway.help: Default route gateway for unicast interface.

schedule.name: schedule
schedule.help: Type of A-A load balancing. Use none if you have external load balancers.

weight.name: weight
weight.help: Weight-round-robin weight for each cluster unit. Syntax <priority> <weight>.

cpu-threshold.name: cpu-threshold
cpu-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing CPU usage weight and high and low thresholds.

memory-threshold.name: memory-threshold
memory-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing memory usage weight and high and low thresholds.

http-proxy-threshold.name: http-proxy-threshold
http-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of HTTP proxy sessions.

ftp-proxy-threshold.name: ftp-proxy-threshold
ftp-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of FTP proxy sessions.

imap-proxy-threshold.name: imap-proxy-threshold
imap-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of IMAP proxy sessions.

nntp-proxy-threshold.name: nntp-proxy-threshold
nntp-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of NNTP proxy sessions.

pop3-proxy-threshold.name: pop3-proxy-threshold
pop3-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of POP3 proxy sessions.

smtp-proxy-threshold.name: smtp-proxy-threshold
smtp-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of SMTP proxy sessions.

override.name: override
override.help: Enable and increase the priority of the unit that should always be primary (master).

priority.name: priority
priority.help: Increase the priority to select the primary unit (0 - 255).

override-wait-time.name: override-wait-time
override-wait-time.help: Delay negotiating if override is enabled (0 - 3600 sec). Reduces how often the cluster negotiates.

monitor.name: monitor
monitor.help: Interfaces to check for port monitoring (or link failure).

pingserver-monitor-interface.name: pingserver-monitor-interface
pingserver-monitor-interface.help: Interfaces to check for remote IP monitoring.

pingserver-secondary-force-reset.name: pingserver-secondary-force-reset
pingserver-secondary-force-reset.help: Enable to force the cluster to negotiate after a remote IP monitoring failover.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable force reset of secondary member after PING server failure.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable force reset of secondary member after PING server failure

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable force reset of secondary member after PING server failure.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable force reset of secondary member after PING server failure

pingserver-flip-timeout.name: pingserver-flip-timeout
pingserver-flip-timeout.help: Time to wait in minutes before renegotiating after a remote IP monitoring failover.

vcluster-status.name: vcluster-status
vcluster-status.help: Enable/disable virtual cluster for virtual clustering.

override.name: override
override.help: Enable and increase the priority of the unit that should always be primary (master).

priority.name: priority
priority.help: Increase the priority to select the primary unit (0 - 255).

override-wait-time.name: override-wait-time
override-wait-time.help: Delay negotiating if override is enabled (0 - 3600 sec). Reduces how often the cluster negotiates.

monitor.name: monitor
monitor.help: Interfaces to check for port monitoring (or link failure).

pingserver-monitor-interface.name: pingserver-monitor-interface
pingserver-monitor-interface.help: Interfaces to check for remote IP monitoring.

pingserver-secondary-force-reset.name: pingserver-secondary-force-reset
pingserver-secondary-force-reset.help: Enable to force the cluster to negotiate after a remote IP monitoring failover.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable force reset of secondary member after PING server failure.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable force reset of secondary member after PING server failure.
options.label: Disable

pingserver-flip-timeout.name: pingserver-flip-timeout
pingserver-flip-timeout.help: Time to wait in minutes before renegotiating after a remote IP monitoring failover.

vdom.name: vdom
vdom.help: Virtual domain(s) in the virtual cluster.

ha-direct.name: ha-direct
ha-direct.help: Enable/disable using ha-mgmt interface for syslog, remote authentication (RADIUS), FortiAnalyzer, FortiSandbox, sFlow, and Netflow.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable using ha-mgmt interface for syslog, remote authentication (RADIUS), FortiAnalyzer, FortiSandbox, sFlow, and Netflow.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable using ha-mgmt interface for syslog, remote authentication (RADIUS), FortiAnalyzer, FortiSandbox, sFlow, and Netflow

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable using ha-mgmt interface for syslog, remote authentication (RADIUS), FortiAnalyzer, FortiSandbox, sFlow, and Netflow.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable using ha-mgmt interface for syslog, remote authentication (RADIUS), FortiAnalyzer, FortiSandbox, sFlow, and Netflow

ssd-failover.name: ssd-failover
ssd-failover.help: Enable/disable automatic HA failover on SSD disk failure.

memory-failover-threshold.name: memory-failover-threshold
memory-failover-threshold.help: Memory usage threshold to trigger memory based failover (0 means using conserve mode threshold in system.global).

memory-failover-monitor-period.name: memory-failover-monitor-period
memory-failover-monitor-period.help: Duration of high memory usage before memory based failover is triggered in seconds (1 - 300, default = 60).

memory-failover-sample-rate.name: memory-failover-sample-rate
memory-failover-sample-rate.help: Rate at which memory usage is sampled in order to measure memory usage in seconds (1 - 60, default = 1).

memory-failover-flip-timeout.name: memory-failover-flip-timeout
memory-failover-flip-timeout.help: Time to wait between subsequent memory based failovers in minutes (6 - 2147483647, default = 6).

failover-hold-time.name: failover-hold-time
failover-hold-time.help: Time to wait before failover (0 - 300 sec, default = 0), to avoid flip.

check-secondary-dev-health.name: check-secondary-dev-health
check-secondary-dev-health.help: Enable/disable secondary dev health check for session load-balance in HA A-A mode.

options.name: aes128-sha1
options.label: Aes128 Sha1
options.description: aes128-sha1    aes128-sha256:aes128-sha256    aes128-sha384:aes128-sha384    aes128-sha512:aes128-sha512    aes192-sha1:aes192-sha1    aes192-sha256:aes192-sha256    aes192-sha384:aes192-sha384    aes192-sha512:aes192-sha512    aes256-sha1:aes256-sha1    aes256-sha256:aes256-sha256    aes256-sha384:aes256-sha384    aes256-sha512:aes256-sha512    aes128gcm:aes128gcm    aes256gcm:aes256gcm    chacha20poly1305:chacha20poly1305

bounce-intf-upon-failover.name: bounce-intf-upon-failover
bounce-intf-upon-failover.help: Enable/disable notification of kernel to bring down and up all monitored interfaces. The setting is used during failovers if gratuitous ARPs do not update the network.

vcluster-id.name: vcluster-id
vcluster-id.help: <enter> to show all vcluster or input vcluster-id
